title: Formula for Difference of Sines as a Product
text: The formula for the sum of sines is $$sin\left(a\right)+sin\left(b\right)=2sin\left(\frac{a+b}{2}\right) cos\left(\frac{a-b}{2}\right)$$

title: Substitute Angles
text: To write the formula for the sum of sines as a product, identify and plug in the unknown values of a and $$b$$.

title: Identifying Unknown Angle a
text: From the formula of $$sin\left(a\right)+sin\left(b\right)$$, what is the value of the angle a in the problem?

title: Identifying Unknown Angle $$b$$
text: From the formula of $$sin\left(a\right)+sin\left(b\right)$$, what is the value of the angle $$b$$ in the problem?

title: Simplifying Expression
text: To simplify, plug in the angles for a and $$b$$ that we identified and divide by $$2$$ to reduce fractions.
